channel.title: What's a Solaris?
channel.description:
This is a Solaris, one of the best computers of the world Unix based, everything is coded in java and it's all java interfaces. I just finished the installation! Pics (warning big images..)! ;)
[img]http://i.min.us/ijfOIc.png[/img] [img]http://i.min.us/ijjNVa.png[/img] [img]http://i.min.us/ijfM9U.png[/img]
What do you think about it? Post your comments! :D

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @Javafire Javafire
item.description:
@Javafire wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:24, topic:382549”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=478342.msg3501054#msg3501054 date=1297734236]
windows 7 > linux, any day truest me, i’ve operated almost every linux OS there is.
[/quote]

Availability > free
edit: (moderators, stay out of my posts.)
open source means nothing when the os doesn’t run shit, OpenSuse’s Novell OS is the only good linux OS i’ve ever used.

How come every post you ever make is absolutely fucking backwards?[/quote]
because i may have dyslexia. no(t)roll, tis the season for firefox autocorrect. unfortuneatley i dont have firefox on this computer.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

[quote=“riku9182, post:31, topic:382549”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=478342.msg3501062#msg3501062 date=1297734694]

It’s not Windows, so it’s good. ;]

windows 7 > linux, any day truest me, i’ve operated almost every linux OS there is.
[/quote]Obviously you’re an idiot.

I dual boot both Ubuntu and Windows 7, which Ubuntu boots about 10x faster than Windows, as well as it doesn’t need the stupid preloading (takes 1-3 minutes for the settings to adapt on Windows, before able to use applications) Linux is up and ready to use within seconds.

Why must you start crap on every thread?[/quote]
Because the member he is “correcting” must be corrected.

OT: I’ve never heard of this, and this is the first time I’ve even seen it. I kind of like it, I don’t know what it can do so which ever. At the moment, I’m choosing Linux over all.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @riku9182 riku9182
item.description:
@riku9182 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”][quote author=Javafire link=topic=478342.msg3501054#msg3501054 date=1297734236]

It’s not Windows, so it’s good. ;]

windows 7 > linux, any day truest me, i’ve operated almost every linux OS there is.
[/quote]Obviously you’re an idiot.

I dual boot both Ubuntu and Windows 7, which Ubuntu boots about 10x faster than Windows, as well as it doesn’t need the stupid preloading (takes 1-3 minutes for the settings to adapt on Windows, before able to use applications) Linux is up and ready to use within seconds.[/quote]
Why must you start crap on every thread?

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:29, topic:382549”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=478342.msg3501354#msg3501354 date=1297745418]

OpenSolaris is really not like Solaris, OpenSolaris is linux based and it’s really not the same comp, Solaris is more than 15 years old. Anyway it’s more for server hosting so it’s not like a personnal or home computer.

OpenSolaris is NOT Linux based, it uses the same code as Solaris.

It’s not Windows, so it’s good. ;]

windows 7 > linux, any day truest me, i’ve operated almost every linux OS there is.

Oh ok, I trust you. :rolleyes: By the way, what you do mean ‘you have to use wines to get adobe working’? It’s not nearly proper english, so I have no idea what you are talking about. If you are talking about flash, it runs on Linux.

Also, you are an idiot if you think something is better because it costs more money. Linux isn’t ‘freeware’, it is Open Source Software, which is entirely different, and everyone agrees (as you would say, all my fellow IT professionals agree), that it is superior to everything else when it comes to servers. Also it runs on anything, where windows only runs on x86 and amd64 PCs.

[/quote]
no i think it’s better quality, and i forgot to add photoshop at the end of adobe there, gimp is for newfags.[/quote]
You truly are a fucking dumbass.

Anything that requires you to pay for the OS, and then use a ($10000) antivirus to keep from getting assfucked is definitely better than something free, and requires you to be a moron to get a virus.

Read full topic

Also, you are an idiot if you think something is better because it costs more money. Linux isn’t ‘freeware’, it is Open Source Software, which is entirely different, and everyone agrees (as you would say, all my fellow IT professionals agree), that it is superior to everything else when it comes to servers. Also it runs on anything, where windows only runs on x86 and amd64 PCs.[/quote]
no i think it’s better quality, and i forgot to add photoshop at the end of adobe there, gimp is for newfags.

Microsoft released Windows Vista because they didn’t have enough money to continue W7 project, BTW, OSX is alot better than W7

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

laurent 248:

OpenSolaris is really not like Solaris, OpenSolaris is linux based and it’s really not the same comp, Solaris is more than 15 years old. Anyway it’s more for server hosting so it’s not like a personnal or home computer.

OpenSolaris is NOT Linux based, it uses the same code as Solaris.

[quote=“Javafire, post:5, topic:382549”][quote author=I Vain I link=topic=478342.msg3500980#msg3500980 date=1297730935]
It’s not Windows, so it’s good. ;]
[/quote]
windows 7 > linux, any day truest me, i’ve operated almost every linux OS there is.[/quote]

Oh ok, I trust you. :rolleyes: By the way, what you do mean ‘you have to use wines to get adobe working’? It’s not nearly proper english, so I have no idea what you are talking about. If you are talking about flash, it runs on Linux.

Also, you are an idiot if you think something is better because it costs more money. Linux isn’t ‘freeware’, it is Open Source Software, which is entirely different, and everyone agrees (as you would say, all my fellow IT professionals agree), that it is superior to everything else when it comes to servers. Also it runs on anything, where windows only runs on x86 and amd64 PCs.

Read full topic

item.title: What's a Solaris?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“laurent 248, post:19, topic:382549”]first line of wikipedia on solaris : Solaris is a Unix operating system originally developed by Sun Microsystems. It superseded their earlier SunOS in 1992. Oracle Solaris, as it is now known, has been owned by Oracle Corporation since Oracle’s acquisition of Sun in January 2010.[2]

I will post the linux date when I’ll find it. :P[/quote]

Linus first released the kernel in 1991.

Read full topic
